      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract int getInputSize()
      Returns the input size of the environment, the output of the agent is generally input directly to the environment, thus the agent output vector size would usually be equal to this.
      abstract int getMinimumStepsToSolve()
      Return the minimum required steps to solve this environment instance.

      Update/set the output based on the given state.
      abstract int getOutputSize()
      Returns the output size of the environment including the reinforcement signal, this is generally input directly to the agent, thus the agent input vector size would usually be equal to this.
      abstract double getPerformanceForState(org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector state) 
      abstract double getRewardForState(org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector state) 
      abstract void increaseDifficulty()
      Adjust the variables determining difficulty to increase the difficulty of environment instances generated by this environment type.
      abstract boolean increaseDifficultyPossible()
      Return true iff it is possible to (further) increase the difficulty of environments of this type, eg by introducing a larger number of obstacles, a more convoluted transform between state and output, etc.

      Set-up the environment configuration.
      java.lang.String toString() 
      abstract double updateStateAndOutput(org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector state, double[] input, double[] output)
      This function should do three things: (1) update the given state given the input; (2) update the given state internally if the environment is dynamic (changes even when if the agent provides no "actions"), and (3) update/set the output based on the new current state.

      • init

        public void init(Properties props)
        Specified by:
        init in interface Configurable
        Parameters:
        props - Configuration parameters.

      • setUp

        public abstract void setUp(int id)
        Set-up the environment configuration.

      • getOutputSize

        public abstract int getOutputSize()
        Returns the output size of the environment including the reinforcement signal, this is generally input directly to the agent, thus the agent input vector size would usually be equal to this.

      • getInputSize

        public abstract int getInputSize()
        Returns the input size of the environment, the output of the agent is generally input directly to the environment, thus the agent output vector size would usually be equal to this.

      • updateStateAndOutput

        public abstract double updateStateAndOutput(org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector state,
                          double[] input,
                          double[] output)
        This function should do three things: (1) update the given state given the input; (2) update the given state internally if the environment is dynamic (changes even when if the agent provides no "actions"), and (3) update/set the output based on the new current state.
        Returns:
        the performance value associated with the new environment state, must be in the range [0, 1].

      • getOutputForState

        public abstract double getOutputForState(org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector state,
                       double[] output)
        Update/set the output based on the given state.
        Returns:
        the performance value associated with the given environment state, must be in the range [0, 1].

      • getRewardForState

        public abstract double getRewardForState(org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector state)
        Returns:
        the reward value associated with the given environment state, must be in the range [0, 1].

      • getPerformanceForState

        public abstract double getPerformanceForState(org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector state)
        Returns:
        the performance value associated with the given environment state, must be in the range [0, 1].

      • getMinimumStepsToSolve

        public abstract int getMinimumStepsToSolve()
        Return the minimum required steps to solve this environment instance.

      • setMinimumStepsToSolve

        public abstract void setMinimumStepsToSolve(int steps)
        Set the minimum required steps to solve this environment instance (generally only for internal use).

      • increaseDifficultyPossible

        public abstract boolean increaseDifficultyPossible()
        Return true iff it is possible to (further) increase the difficulty of environments of this type, eg by introducing a larger number of obstacles, a more convoluted transform between state and output, etc.

      • increaseDifficulty

        public abstract void increaseDifficulty()
        Adjust the variables determining difficulty to increase the difficulty of environment instances generated by this environment type. The setUp(int) method will be called immediately after calling this method to generate a new environment instance.

      • logToImageForTrial

        public void logToImageForTrial(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                      int imageSize)
        Optionally allow rendering (some aspect) of the environment configuration to an image. The image is used to track the progress of the agent through the environment. This method is called for every trial and is only called if the environment size is 2 (thus allowing showing the current state as a point on a 2D plane). An example implementation may render parts of the state space that are inaccessible.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object to render on.
        imageSize - The size of the image (width and height).

      • logToImage

        public void logToImage(java.lang.String baseFileName,
              int imageSize)
        Optionally allow rendering the environment configuration to an image or images. This method is called once for a set of trials. Implementations must handle creating the images and saving them to disk.
        Parameters:
        baseFileName - The directory and base file name to use for the images saved to disk.
        imageSize - The (suggested) image size.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
